TopicTitle: The Official Kerbin Cup Tournament Thread - Final Entries Posted

Articles.Content: OK, who did what entry? And let 'er rip, clown_baby!
I'm totally okay, I can wait.
I'll hold off telling you which one we made until the announcement, just in case.
I hope the next challenge is more functional than aesthetic. Aesthetics are cool and the entries were excellent, but there's more to KSP than pretty things.

edit:

I'll hold off telling you which one we made until the announcement, just in case.

well that made me paranoid.

Edited June 23, 2014 by clown_baby
hahaha CRAP!!!, I want to know who did what, what got voted, and who wins!
Awww crud, pool's closed already. Now I missed the vote.
Whatever happens, I had fun, mostly.
*Queues up epic music*
*Queues up epic music*
My God, it sounds like a swarm of angry bees...
Congratulations to the winners from challenge 1. To those of you who were eliminated, you still did great work. Better luck next next time

So, which entries won? We still don't know which belongs to whom.

Edit: I see, you put the team numbers in the results, my bad.

*Salutes the A-Team*

It was a pleasure competing against you, good sirs.
We made it team! Party hard!
I made it through so the hyperEdit rant really isn't needed. People really liked the orbit one which is cool, they figured out what the people wanted. Even though it was a building competition......

aww. bummer.

well played guys.

wait a second... why did team 2's get the most votes and the team 3's the least votes!

I smell conspiracy!

That's the sound clip, in case anyone can't load YouTube.

Team Jedi is not YouTube oriented, but I'm sure we'll come up with something! But now I'm worried about Team ITWBI...

EDIT: In that they'll definitely beat us, that is. Edited June 23, 2014 by The Jedi Master
I wanted to post it here before, but I couldn't before. Now, after result i can

In case anyone is wondering, those are very cleverly built procedural wings in the fourth forum entry. I also had to look twice!
That's some neat work then. I, and I suspect many others, honestly thought it was a custom mod.

Does anyone else think competition 2's requirements are too stringent? 100% stock is going to make capturing good video very difficult (not to mention limiting the creativity), and 50% of time at KSC is also limiting it quite a bit.

Big pleasure competing with all of you

and big hug to all A-Team members, specially if they are nerd girls!!!

On a side note: We will be doing some explanations of our design in our forum post here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83782-Kerbal-Cup-I-Think-We-Broke-Team-Forum-Threadsplosion-2000

Our cup (forum team 4) wasn't modded!, It was made using procedural wings, with more than 1.000 parts!, was sad to read some kerbanaults thinking it wasn't VAB heavy

SEE YOU IN THE NEXT CHALLENGE!!!

Here is another trophy we made. It was my design and I just wanted to share it here. In the end we decided to submit the other trophy.

The new challenge will be interesting, only stock parts.

50% of time at KSC is also limiting it quite a bit.

Yeah. "Hey we have a game with an entire solar system in it, here's the launchpad."

Aahhh, video - how I love it [/sarcasm]

Here's a hint teams - I won't be watching anything more than a couple of minutes long and I won't be voting for anything I don't watch. Presumably though, a lot of people who don't have broadband caps will think the exact opposite.
